message.content:
Step 1: Identify relevant numbers.
• Cost of Goods Sold (COGS) from the income statement: 1,249,000.00.
• Inventory values from the balance sheet:
 – Beginning Inventory = 0.00 (as provided)
 – Ending Inventory = 112,000.00

Step 2: Calculate Average Inventory.
Average Inventory = (Beginning Inventory + Ending Inventory) / 2 
            = (0 + 112,000) / 2 
            = 56,000.00

Step 3: Compute the Inventory Turnover Ratio.
Inventory Turnover Ratio = COGS / Average Inventory 
            = 1,249,000.00 / 56,000.00 
            ≈ 22.30

Thus, the inventory turns roughly 22.30 times during the period.

Final answer in JSON format:

{
  "solution": {
    "Inventory Turnover Ratio": "22.30"
  }
}
